posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
THIS IS A REMAKE OF "THE HEADSMAN" with a racial change prompted by suggestions from the board- he's even tougher as a Dwarf!

Played HOTU for the first time using a Dwarven War Axe and - lo and behold - one dropped with the Vorpal property (which I don't recall seeing/using since my PNP days 40 years ago).  After looking it up, I start wondering what would it look like if a character had to make 2 different saves - fortitude (against DevCrit) and reflex (against Vorpal) at the same time?  I designed this dude for that purpose.  Leveled up through SOU/HOTU and the Sands of Fate trilogy.  

I know the class combo has been done to death . . . but even with a low-threat range crit weapon like the Dwarven Waraxe, coupling it with a vorpal property (the one in the game has a DC of 18 vs Reflex), Dev Crit (DC 42 vs Fort), Overwhelming Crit - anything that's not crit immune will die quickly.  For the crit immune - the Waraxe is 1-10, +11 (STR), +6 (WS/EWS), and the IKD Discipline Check is 46 against medium sized opponents (42 vs. large, 38 vs. huge).

Saves are respectable.  In a taunting environment, the points in Search can go to concentration, instead.

IF potion/items are available to buff CHA, he becomes a formidable duelist with +11 to attack, damage & saves for CHA modifier rounds.
